summary: This is an internal email chain from September 11, 2020, forwarding a status update on data processing projects related to the case 'US v. Epstein'. It details the completion status and estimated timelines for creating searchable indexes and copying hard drives, indicating ongoing post-conviction or post-investigation evidence handling.

events.title: Estimated completion for multiple data projects
events.description: Multiple entries for 'US v. Epstein (SW Returns)' and other data sets are estimated to be completed, with dtSearch indexes being built.

events.title: Estimated follow-up for 'US v. Epstein'
events.description: An entry for 'US v. Epstein' is listed as 'Awaiting Client Follow-Up' with an estimated date of September 15, 2020.

events.title: Estimated completion for EFTA00102259 and other data
events.description: The document EFTA00102259 and another data set are estimated to be completed.

events.title: Estimated hard drive copying and delivery
events.description: Multiple entries for 'Copying Hard Drive' and 'Awaiting Hard Drive Delivery' are estimated for completion.

events.title: Estimated completion for a data project
events.description: One data project related to 'US v. Epstein' is estimated to be completed by September 30, 2020.

locations: WP (likely White Plains, NY, given SDNY context)
keyFacts: The email is a status update on data processing for the case 'US v. Epstein', indicating ongoing evidence management in September 2020.
It references the creation of dtSearch indexes for case data, which are used for text searching and analysis of digital evidence.
Multiple tasks are 'Awaiting Client Follow-Up', suggesting coordination between a project management team and the legal trial team (likely SDNY).
The document IDs EFTA00102259 and EFTA00102260 are referenced, which are part of the Epstein case document set.
The sender is traveling to 'WP' (White Plains) and will join a meeting, indicating active coordination on these data projects.
